Holds ERC20 balances per user for a set of registered collateral tokens. - Admins configure per-token risk params, caps, and per-token pause flags. - Only Clearinghouse can move funds out (withdrawFor / seize / sweepFees). - Valuation helpers call an external Oracle by symbol and apply haircuts.","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An operation with an ERC-20 token failed."}]},"events":{"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"creditFromPool(address,address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of collateral to credit.","pool":"Address of the liquidity pool that sourced the funds.","token":"Collateral token being credited.","user":"Account receiving the credit."}},"deposit(address,uint256,address)":{"details":"Uses balance delta to support fee-on-transfer tokens. Caps of 0 mean unlimited. Reverts if token disabled or deposits paused. Caller must have approved tokens.","params":{"amount":"Amount to transferFrom.","onBehalfOf":"Account whose internal balance increases.","token":"ERC20 collateral token."},"returns":{"received":"Actual amount credited after transfer fees, if any."}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"registerCollateral((address,uint256,uint16,uint16,uint256,uint256,bool,bool,bool,string))":{"details":"If the token already exists it will be overwritten and re-emitted. Be mindful that changing baseUnit or oracleSymbol affects valuation."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setClearinghouse(address)":{"params":{"_clearinghouse":"Clearinghouse contract address."}},"setCollateralParams(address,(address,uint256,uint16,uint16,uint256,uint256,bool,bool,bool,string))":{"params":{"cfg":"New configuration values.","token":"Collateral token address to update."}},"setOracle(address)":{"params":{"_oracle":"Oracle address implementing getPrice(symbol) returning 1e18 price."}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"sweepFees(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Minimal implementation: simply transfers out up to amount from contract balance. Implementations may keep separate accounting for fees; this function is a thin shim."},"withdrawFor(address,address,uint256,address)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount to withdraw.","to":"Destination address receiving the tokens.","token":"ERC20 token to withdraw.","user":"Account whose balance is decreased."}}},"title":"CollateralVault","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"VAULT_ADMIN_ROLE()":{"notice":"Additional admin role besides DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE."},"balanceOf(address,address)":{"notice":"Get user's internal balance for a token."},"clearinghouse()":{"notice":"Clearinghouse contract allowed to execute outflows."},"collateralConfigs(address)":{"notice":"Per-token configuration keyed by token address."},"constructor":{"notice":"Initializes the admin to the deployer."},"creditFromPool(address,address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Credits a user's internal balance after funds have been transferred in from a liquidity pool."},"deposit(address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Deposit collateral into the vault for a user."},"getAccountCollateralValueX18(address)":{"notice":"Sum haircut-adjusted USD value across all enabled collaterals for a user."},"getConfig(address)":{"notice":"Read the full configuration for a token."},"getTokenValueX18(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Value a token amount in USD 1e18 using oracleSymbol and baseUnit, applying haircut."},"isDepositPaused(address)":{"notice":"Whether deposits are paused for a token."},"isEnabled(address)":{"notice":"Whether the token is enabled for valuation and deposits."},"isWithdrawPaused(address)":{"notice":"Whether withdrawals are paused for a token."},"oracle()":{"notice":"Address of the price Oracle used for valuation helpers."},"registerCollateral((address,uint256,uint16,uint16,uint256,uint256,bool,bool,bool,string))":{"notice":"Register a new collateral token with full params."},"registeredTokens(uint256)":{"notice":"List of registered collateral token addresses for iteration in views."},"seize(address,address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Move collateral internally between users (e.g., liquidation). CH only."},"setClearinghouse(address)":{"notice":"Wire the Clearinghouse that can initiate outflows."},"setCollateralParams(address,(address,uint256,uint16,uint16,uint256,uint256,bool,bool,bool,string))":{"notice":"Update an existing token's configuration."},"setOracle(address)":{"notice":"Set the global Oracle contract used for valuation."},"setPause(address,bool,bool)":{"notice":"Update per-token deposit/withdraw pause flags."},"sweepFees(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Sweep protocol fees held by the vault. CH only."},"totalOf(address)":{"notice":"Total contract balance of a token (sum of all users and any fees)."},"userBalances(address,address)":{"notice":"Per-user balances for each token held in the vault."},"withdrawFor(address,address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Withdraw collateral on behalf of a user to a destination address. CH only."}},"notice":"Custodial multi-collateral vault for cross-margin params.pool: Address of the liquidity pool that sourced the funds.

deposit(address,uint256,address).details: Uses balance delta to support fee-on-transfer tokens. Caps of 0 mean unlimited. Reverts if token disabled or deposits paused. Caller must have approved tokens.

returns.received: Actual amount credited after transfer fees, if any.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

registerCollateral((address,uint256,uint.details: If the token already exists it will be overwritten and re-emitted. Be mindful that changing baseUnit or oracleSymbol affects valuation.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params._oracle: Oracle address implementing getPrice(symbol) returning 1e18 price.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

sweepFees(address,address,uint256).details: Minimal implementation: simply transfers out up to amount from contract balance. Implementations may keep separate accounting for fees; this function is a thin shim.

balanceOf(address,address).notice: Get user's internal balance for a token.

clearinghouse().notice: Clearinghouse contract allowed to execute outflows.

collateralConfigs(address).notice: Per-token configuration keyed by token address.

constructor.notice: Initializes the admin to the deployer.

creditFromPool(address,address,address,u.notice: Credits a user's internal balance after funds have been transferred in from a liquidity pool.

deposit(address,uint256,address).notice: Deposit collateral into the vault for a user.

getAccountCollateralValueX18(address).notice: Sum haircut-adjusted USD value across all enabled collaterals for a user.

getConfig(address).notice: Read the full configuration for a token.

getTokenValueX18(address,uint256).notice: Value a token amount in USD 1e18 using oracleSymbol and baseUnit, applying haircut.

isDepositPaused(address).notice: Whether deposits are paused for a token.

isEnabled(address).notice: Whether the token is enabled for valuation and deposits.

isWithdrawPaused(address).notice: Whether withdrawals are paused for a token.

oracle().notice: Address of the price Oracle used for valuation helpers.

registerCollateral((address,uint256,uint.notice: Register a new collateral token with full params.

registeredTokens(uint256).notice: List of registered collateral token addresses for iteration in views.

seize(address,address,address,uint256).notice: Move collateral internally between users (e.g., liquidation). CH only.

setClearinghouse(address).notice: Wire the Clearinghouse that can initiate outflows.

setOracle(address).notice: Set the global Oracle contract used for valuation.

sweepFees(address,address,uint256).notice: Sweep protocol fees held by the vault. CH only.

totalOf(address).notice: Total contract balance of a token (sum of all users and any fees).

userBalances(address,address).notice: Per-user balances for each token held in the vault.

withdrawFor(address,address,uint256,addr.notice: Withdraw collateral on behalf of a user to a destination address. CH only.
